Key Match Events: Cristian Javier struggled, recording just one out and allowing three runs and four hits in the first inning.
Corey Seager hit a 440-foot home run.
Evan Carter walked, stole second base, and scored on a single by Adolis García.
Adolis García stole second and scored on a pop-fly single by Mitch Garver.
Alex Bregman hit a solo homer in the bottom of the third.
Evan Carter hit a two-run double and Adolis García hit a two-run single in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Dusty Baker expressed that the team has nothing to be ashamed of despite the loss.
Alex Bregman reflected on the team's lack of execution compared to previous years.
Catcher Martín Maldonado commented on Cristian Javier's struggles with command and off-speed pitches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston Astros went 1-5 at home in the playoffs.
Houston is the only big league team to lose four home games in a seven-game postseason series twice.
Big league teams are 3-9 in postseason history when their starting pitcher lasts less than an inning in a winner-take-all game.
